CactusTool.funcs.file.filter_file(files, file_style)[source]¶

Choose the file end with specified file_style

Parameters

  • files (list) – file list in absolute path.

  • file_style (str) –

    There are few file_style you can choose:

    • parfile: parameter file

    • scalar: Scalar file

    • ascii: ASCII file

    • hdf5: HDF5 file

    • debug: NaNmask

Returns

file list

CactusTool.funcs.file.select_header_h5(header, var=-1, it=-1, rl=-1, c=-1)[source]¶

Select specified header in return of header_h5().

Parameters

  • var (str) – -1: all variable.

  • it (int) – -1: all iteration number.

  • rl (int) – -1: all refinement level.

  • c (int) – -1: all component.

Returns

a list of header

CactusTool.funcs.interp module¶

class CactusTool.funcs.interp.Interpolator(points, values)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class representing a grid function defined on a Carpet grid hierarchy.

:param str interp : interpolation type.

  • None: no interpolation. The gridarray can only be evaluated at grid points.

  • nearest: nearest neighbour interpolation

  • linear: linear interpolation

Parameters

  • values – tuple of nd.array of float, with shapes (m1, ), …, (mn, ). The points defining the regular grid in n dimensions.

  • data – array_like, shape (m1, …, mn, …). The data on the regular grid in n dimensions.

CactusTool.funcs.log module¶

CactusTool.funcs.ts module¶

class CactusTool.funcs.ts.TimeSeries(t, y)[source]¶

Bases: object

This class represents real or complex valued time series.

Parameters

  • t – Sampling times, need to be strictly increasing.

  • y – Data samples, can be real or complex valued.

absolute()[source]¶
clip(tmin=None, tmax=None)[source]¶

Throws away data outside the time intarval [tmin, tmax]. If tmin or tmax are not specified or None, it does not remove anything from this side.

Parameters

  • tmin – Left boundary cut interval or None.

  • tmax – Right boundary cut interval or None.

conjugate()[source]¶
copy()[source]¶
deriv(order)[source]¶

Compute derivative of order<=5 using splines.

Parameters

order (int) – Order of differentiation.

imag()[source]¶
integrate(a=None, b=None)[source]¶

Compute the definite integral over the interval [a,b] using spline representations. If lower and/or upper bound is not specified, use boundary of the timeseries.

Parameters

  • a – Lower integration bound or None.

  • b – Upper integration bound or None.

phase()[source]¶

Compute the complex phase of a complex-valued signal such that no phase wrap-arounds occur.

Returns

Continuous complex phase.

real()[source]¶
remove_mean()[source]¶

Remove the mean value from the data.

resample(times, ext=0)[source]¶

Resamples the timeseries to new times.

Parameters

  • times – New sample times.

  • ext (0 for extrapolation, 1 for returning zero, 2 for ValueError.) – How to handle points outside the time interval.

Returns

Resampled time series.

save(fname)[source]¶

Saves into simple ascii format with 2 collumns (t,y) for real valued data and 3 collumns (t, Re(y), Im(y)) for complex valued data.

Parameters

fname (str) – File name.

shift(tshift)[source]¶

CactusTool.funcs.unit module¶

This module provides a class Units representing unit systems or unit conversions. All expressed in SI units.

Module contents¶

This modular provided many useful functions needed by other modular.
